abstracts.cdata!:
The Agricultural Services and Producer
            organizations Project for Senegal had the following ratings:
            the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability was likely,
            the institutional development impact was substantial, and
            the Bank and borrower performance were both satisfactory.
            Lessons learned from the project: Institutional changes take
            time and require adequate support. Producer organizations
            are key drivers to foster changes and ensure sustainability.
            Multi-stakeholders decision-making mechanisms are efficient
            for allocating funds to activities that are relevant and
            coherent with producer needs and interests. Agricultural
            Services and Producer organizations Program (PSAOP)
            experience has demonstrated that asking local institutions
            to be fully responsible of their respective component as
            implementing agencies can be more efficient than having a
            temporary PIU. Getting economic results and measurable
            impacts, demand-driven funds should not be restricted to
            soft investments but should allow for physical investments
            and equipment.
